content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a continuous function such that <math alttext="f of x equals, f of negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="the integral from negative 2 to 0, of, f of x, d x, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, f of x, d x, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 1, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
